intro: Marthella, commonly known as the common marthella, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its composite flower heads, which consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats and is native to regions in Europe and western Asia. Marthella species are often found in sandy or gravelly soils and are adapted to thrive in arid conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and linear, while its flowers are yellow or orange in color.
